page.title: 09AGRICULTURE 2 DOWNDERRY
page.content: (2)TREGUNNICK. 167 Acres,freehold (Bank assisted !).Traditional methods operate on a farm of average local size.50 acres of steep,low grade land is kept as permanent pasture or small woodland.60 acres of spring barley,3 of spring greens,9 of maize (for silage),and 6 of maincrop potatoes.The remainder is grass for direct grazing or silage,to maintain 40 milking cows (Friesians) and 20 followers.A farm bull (Charollais X Angus) gives young stock acceptable for beef calves. In 1985 the farm has fully utilised its E.E.C.quota of 189,000 litres. Sales of barley (70 tons),calves and store bullocks raised income.Inputs include 30 tons of artificial fertilizer and 50 tons of cattle cake. Some casual labour employed (26 man weeks ).Most work done by the Farmer using tractors,harvesters,ploughs etc.
